area.key:
This is the free edition of CMSImport which is limited in functionality.
Check out our website for all the differences or buy the pro version today!
Thank you for trying CMSImport ! You are currently running in trial mode which means CMSImport functionality is limited. Install a license, or buy a license today to unlock all the features.
Select the type of information you want to import into Umbraco
Select the type of data you want to import into Umbraco
CMSImport - Implement this title in your dataprovider
Implement this in the data provider
CMSImport - Implement this title in your import provider
Implement this in the Import provider
Map the database columns against the Umbraco properties. Use the settings icon for additional mapping options that are available on some properties.
Please validate your input and press Next to import the data.
All child definitions will also be imported
Import definition is loaded from the database with error(s), fix them before importing your data
Url requires authentication, specify Username and Password.
Import data from an excel file
Upload an Excel file, or select the Url of an Excel file to import data form an Excel file. The Excel component works best when you don't have any formula's or formatting.
Can't open the uploaded Excel file
Import data from a CSV file
Upload a CSV file, or select the Url of a CSV file to import data form a CSV file.
Can't open the uploaded Csv file
Error validating the CSV file. The header column '{0}' is found multiple times! Make sure the CSV file uses unique header columns!

Error validating the CSV file. You have a duplicate column name in your datasource, please check that all column names are unique in your csv file and that the first row of your csv file is the header row.
Import data from a XML file
Upload a XML file, or select the Url of a XML file to import data form a XML file.
When selected the parent element info prefixed with parent_ will also be included. This allows you to easily set parent key info for structured imports.
Can't open the uploaded Xml file
Specify a connectionstring and SQL query to import data from Sqlserver (express)

Below you can enable import definitions for certain user types. This functionality is different from the normal import wizard. The end user can only pick a configured Import definition and can only upload a datasource (only when a file datasource was used during creation of the import definition).
The import functionality allows users to import the selected import definitions

Specify file extensions for files that must be imported when mapped against a Richtext property, other file extensions will be ignored. When mapped against a normal media picker all file extensions will be picked up.
Parse media for the following domain urls

CMSImport can only import files that ares stored in the rootfolder of Umbraco by default. Sometimes a full url is specified in a field that is mapped against a Richtext property. This setting allows you to specify domain urls, so url's containing these domain urls will be converted to relative paths, example http://www.cmsimport.com/ images/screenshot.png will be converted to /images/screenshot.png when you specify the domain url http://www.cmsimport.com/
Specify the virtual path where media can be found on disk.
When checked CMSImport will keep the folder structure in the media library during import.
Select the media type you use for importing images.
Select the media type you use for importing files.
Select the media type you use for creating folders.
Specify properties you don't want to map in the import process. By default some Member properties such as umbracoFailedPasswordAttempts are listed.
The amount of records in the datasource exceeded the Trial License limit. Buy a Pro license to lift this limit.
Deleting documents that are no longer in the data source.
Specify the content import specific settings
Only uncheck this option when you don't have a primary key in your datasource.
Select the column which is related to the primary key of the parent Import, so we can determine the structure.
When checked CMSImport will delete all records that were imported before but are not in the current data source. Check the manual for more details
Select foreign key for recursive import
Parent relation is required to determine the structure
Primary key is required when update is enabled
Recursive key is required when recursive import is enabled
When checked CMSImport will delete all records that were imported before but are not in the current data source. Check the manual for more details
Location for the content picker is required
Media location for the media picker is required
Image location for Rich text editor is required when you enable image import
File location for Rich text editor is required when you enable file import
The import was canceled by the user. Some records were still imported
Use a comma separated string to notify multiple email addresses.
The import will not start before the previous import task finished
Run every x minutes need to be numeric and at least one minute
The scheduler module is not running, this means Scheduled tasks will not execute. Check the manual how you can configure the Scheduled task module manually.
Last items from the Scheduled task log
Are you sure you want to remove all items from the log file?
Log for scheduled import is cleared
Import data from a JSON file
Upload a JSON file, or select the Url of a JSON file to import data from a JSON file.
Import data from a JSON file
Select a JSON file and use JSONPath http://goessner.net/articles/JsonPath/ to select a collection of items to import.
Upload a BlogML file, or select the Url of a BlogML file to import data from a BlogML file.
Import BlogML Authors from a BlogML file
Import BlogML Categories from a BlogML file
Import BlogML Posts from a BlogML file
Import BlogML Comments from a BlogML file
Import BlogML Tags from a BlogML file
Import data from a RSS file
Upload a Rss, or select the Url of a RSS file to import data from a RSS file.
Upload a WordPress file, or select the Url of a WordPress file to import data from a WordPress file.
Import Authors from a WordPress file
Import categories from a WordPress file
Import comments from a WordPress file
Import pages from a WordPress file
Import posts from a WordPress file
Import tags from a WordPress file
